synergyviewcore.projects.ui

Class PickWorkspaceDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jface.window.Window
      • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog
        • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TrayDialog
          • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TitleAreaDialog
            • synergyviewcore.projects.ui.PickWorkspaceDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jface.window.IShellProvider

    public class PickWorkspaceDialog
extends org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TitleAreaDialog
    Dialog that lets/forces a user to enter/select a workspace that will be used when saving all configuration files and settings. This dialog is shown at startup of the GUI just after the splash screen has shown.
    Author:
    Phyo Kyaw (adapted from Emil Crumhorn)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PickWorkspaceDialog

        public PickWorkspaceDialog(boolean switchWorkspace,
                   org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image wizardImage)
        Creates a new workspace dialog with a specific image as title-area image.
        Parameters:
        switchWorkspace - true if we're using this dialog as a switch workspace dialog
        wizardImage - Image to show

    • Method Detail

      • checkAndCreateWorkspaceRoot

        public static boolean checkAndCreateWorkspaceRoot(java.lang.String wsRoot)
        Checks to see if a workspace exists at a given directory string, and if not, creates it. Also puts our identifying file inside that workspace.
        Parameters:
        wsRoot - Workspace root directory as string
        Returns:
        true if all checks and creations succeeded, false if there was a problem

      • checkWorkspaceDirectory

        public static java.lang.String checkWorkspaceDirectory(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell parentShell,
                                       java.lang.String workspaceLocation,
                                       boolean askCreate,
                                       boolean fromDialog)
        Ensures a workspace directory is OK in regards of reading/writing, etc. This method will get called externally as well.
        Parameters:
        parentShell - Shell parent shell
        workspaceLocation - Directory the user wants to use
        askCreate - Whether to ask if to create the workspace or not in this location if it does not exist already
        fromDialog - Whether this method was called from our dialog or from somewhere else just to check a location
        Returns:
        null if everything is ok, or an error message if not

      • copyFiles

        public static void copyFiles(java.io.File src,
             java.io.File dest)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This function will copy files or directories from one location to another. note that the source and the destination must be mutually exclusive. This function can not be used to copy a directory to a sub directory of itself. The function will also have problems if the destination files already exist.
        Parameters:
        src - -- A File object that represents the source for the copy
        dest - -- A File object that represents the destination for the copy.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to copy.

      • getLastSetWorkspaceDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getLastSetWorkspaceDirectory()
        Returns the last set workspace directory from the preferences.
        Returns:
        null if none

      • isRememberWorkspace

        public static boolean isRememberWorkspace()
        Returns whether the user selected "remember workspace" in the preferences.
        Returns:
        true, if is remember workspace

      • getSelectedWorkspaceLocation

        public java.lang.String getSelectedWorkspaceLocation()
        Returns whatever path the user selected in the dialog.
        Returns:
        Path
